solution_line_template: First find the value of the {num_cards_traded} cards Matt trades: ${card_value_traded}/card * {num_cards_traded} cards = $<<{card_value_traded}*{num_cards_traded}={value_cards_traded}>>{value_cards_traded}

Then find the total value of the {num_cards_received_type1} ${value_card_received_type1} cards: {num_cards_received_type1} cards * ${value_card_received_type1}/card = $<<{num_cards_received_type1}*{value_card_received_type1}={value_cards_received_type1}>>{value_cards_received_type1}

Then subtract the value of the cards Marcus gave up from the value of the cards he gained to find his profit: ${value_card_received_type2} + ${value_cards_received_type1} - ${value_cards_traded} = $<<{value_card_received_type2}+{value_cards_received_type1}-{value_cards_traded}={profit}>>{profit}
